items.preText:
11.59 am Umpires and openers walking out. Bangladesh also taking the field. We're all set to start. Chanderpaul Hemraj and Shai Hope in the middle. Mustafizur will take the new ball. Departure from the norm for Bangladesh, who've been opening with spinners. Meanwhile, this is also Mashrafe Mortaza's 200th ODI for Bangladesh. It's his 202nd overall, but two of those were for Asia XI.

Tanvir: "In previous two game, batting 2nd team won, it's easy to chase a target then setting a target. Mashrafi did the right thing. Good luck Bangladesh. " Reshad: "I don't think picking up a seam bowling all rounder will help. Since WI is a bit weak in spin, BD should have picked Taijul instead. " Shahin Newaz: "Saifuddin is a poor change in place of rubel... Rubel has the knack of bowling quick in a good length on a consistent basis where as saifuddin is more of a change of pace bowler..." Sazedur Rahman: "I would love to see Mithun instead of Imrul, and Saifuddin instead of Rubel. Mithun will give more strength in middle order while Saifuddin can hit the ball hard at the end part of the innings. I think BD missed 15~20 runs short in the slog over in last match." - they've listened to you Sazedur and made exactly those changes. Kazi: "Honestly, if Bangladesh prepares another spinning track then I weep for progress because while I love to see Bangladesh prosper and they have scaled mountains in recent times, they are still lacking the expertise (at least by the looks of it) to tackle genuine fast bowlers, something that Oshane Thomas looks to be. and the sad part is that the Bangladeshi batsmen actually have the talent but the always end up overcompensating for one another... All in all I do sincerely hope they win today." - Well at least they won't have to tackle Oshane today. Sri: "Aww, the series is already done.. Bangladesh lead by 2-0, not according to me, its according to you brother! Coz, at 11:20AM, its you who stated that Shai Hope's knock lifted Bangladesh to Victory! I don't get my good comments published. So trying to be the Antogonist, as how i am in my upcoming SouthIndian telefilm " - Ooops, corrected that. Good luck with your career under the arc lights. Follow our ball-by-ball on the set! 11.50 am So both teams have made changes. The match will start in ten minutes, and it is a series decider. Are the changes to the XIs justified? We'll know at the end of the game.

Bangladesh have won the toss and elected to bowl We'll have the XIs for you shortly. Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Liton Das, 3 Soumya Sarkar, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Shakib Al Hasan, 6 Mohammad Mithun, 7 Mahmudullah, 8 Mohammad Saifuddin, 9 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 10 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 11 Mustafizur Rahman Two changes for the home side. Mohammad Mithun comes in for Imrul Kayes, and Mohammad Saifuddin replaces Rubel Hossain.

Well well, here's a bit of a shocker. West Indies are without Oshane Thomas. Is he dropped? Unlikely after Rovman Powell built up the whole 'Bangladesh have a weakness against pace' shtick. We'll find out soon enough. Fabian Allen has replaced him in the XI meanwhile. West Indies: 1 Chandrapaul Hemraj, 2 Shai Hope (wk), 3 Darren Bravo, 4 Marlon Samuels, 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Rovman Powell (capt), 7 Roston Chase, 8 Fabian Allen, 9 Keemo Paul, 10 Devendra Bishoo, 11 Kemar Roach

Shorifsust: "Jony, I am not agree with you. As Bangladesh is highly depend on spin, considering the dew factors Bangladesh will prefer bowling first if they win the toss. " - well you've been proven right. Sazedur Rahman: "@Manoj: Agree; but problem is if there is a 1/2 wickets fall, it gives pressure immediately next batsman that effects the run rate. I think the opening batsman just play to the merit of the ball." 11.26 am "It is a fact. Bangladesh don't like fast bowling." That's not me, that's West Indies captain Rovman Powell after the second ODI. Will Bangladesh be making a statement of intent against Oshane Thomas after that?

Johny: "I think toss will be a big factor today. Both team want to have bat first due to dew. " Manoj: "Bangladesh's top order needs to get a flying start. They can't be playing outdated cricket that England used to play 4 years ago. They should try and achieve 300 plus totals on regular basis irrespective of the conditions." - I understand the sentiment, but practically, you can't aim for 300-plus irrespective of the conditions. Sometimes you have to respect the conditions, or you could end up 180 all out where 250 is a winning score. 11.20 am If nothing else, West Indies will definitely be buoyed by the heroics of Shai Hope. He almost single-handedly lifted West Indies to victory in the second ODI with a magnificent innings, a career-best 146*. None of the top order could build a sustained partnership with him, and everyone scored at slower than the required rate, but Hope kept at it, took the match deep, and showed faith in Keemo Paul to pull off a last-over win. Relieve the knock in his own words.

11.15 am Mohammad Isam, our Bangladesh correspondent, has made his way over to the picturesque Sylhet for this match. The first two were held in Dhaka. "Beautiful morning, lone lines outside," says Isam. While waiting for the toss, you can run your eye over his preview for this game.

11.10 am Hello and welcome to our coverage of the third and final ODI between Bangladesh and West Indies. It couldn't have been set up better, with West Indies storming back in the second ODI to level the series 1-1, making this an enticing decider. I'm Saurabh Somani and will be joined by Hemant Brar on commentary today.
items.text: some shape away from the left-hander from over the wicket. Back of a length outside off, and moving away
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hemraj, no run

items.text: gets it straighter, back of a length again. Defended from the crease
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hemraj, no run

items.text: strays down the pads, but he can't connect with the flick. The ball rolls to short fine off the pad for a leg-bye
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hemraj, 1 leg bye

items.text: good length, keeps it straight on the stumps, Hope pats it back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: sumptuous shot that's how you get off the mark. Angled across him, and Hope leans into the cover drive to bisect the cordon in the circle and send the ball purring to the fence
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: good length, slanted a mite across, he defends to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.preText:
Spin from the other end, here's Mehidy. One slip in place

Saadi: "Honestly, Bangladesh should have replaced Sarkar with Saifuddin, Brings more depth in both batting and bowling, we don't need Sarkar who plays 1 innings good out of 14-15 innings. It could even be a good combination for the World Cup considering the pitches they have."
items.text: good length from round the wicket, floated up a bit. Not great turn, he lets it go through outside off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: fuller on the stumps, defended back
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: good length, but angled more into the batsman, who stays in his crease and punches to cover
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: tossed up on off, and he comes on the front foot to drive, but straight to short cover
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: tossed up again outside off, he comes forward to defend. Inside-edges on to pad
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: fine shot, tossed up again but too full and he comes forward to ease this through cover with a pleasing drive. Both batsmen off the mark with boundaries
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, FOUR runs

items.preText:
Round the wicket goes Fizz

Syed Kabir: "So here we are again. Imrul Kayes brought back to rescue us in the Asia Cup, scored 328 runs in 3 innings against Zimbabwe and then suddenly 2 failures and he is back out. Whereas Liton and Soumya keep getting chance after chance. "
items.text: good length angled into the batsman, who unfurls a crisp cover drive, but straight to the fielder
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: driven very firmly again, too full outside off and Hope is coming on to the front foot nicely and getting the drives going. But he keeps finding the fielder inside the circle at cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: angled across, and this time Hope punches from close to his body to the left of cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: james: "Powell's comment on BD having a weakness against pace was nothing but a means to rile-up a team that's easily, as seen in the past, swayed into emotional responses. Hope that one silly comment doesn't make them go out and try and smash everything out of the park. BD have won matches against better pace bowling sides recently."
items.text: strays on to the pads, and he flicks him, but not with any conviction. The ball rolls to short midwicket. That was the slower ball, off-cutter
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hemraj, no run

items.text: through him almost Got his bat down just in time to this good length one on the stumps and the ball took the toe-end, bounced on the ground and over the stumps. Narrow escape.
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hemraj, no run

items.text: given some room outside off and he cuts this to third man
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hemraj, 1 run

items.preText: Shorifsust: "Can't wait anymore for an aggressive knock from Tamim. I have been missing his early days batting hitting down the wicke! Ahh! That momemts in 2007 world cu, he hit Zahir khan over and over again going down the wicket and Bangladesh defeat India comprehensively headed by young and aggressive Tamim, Mushfique..... Ahh! Recollecting! "
items.text: tossed up outside off, he steers it to point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, punched to cover
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: flatter on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler to mid-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, no run

items.text: tossed up outside off, but drags it down a bit and he uses the turn to go deep in his crease and cut it past point for a nice looking boundary
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, FOUR runs

items.text: cuts it straight to point Soft dismissal. It was too short, and he cleared his front leg to try and flay it on the off side, but only ended up thick-edging it. Easy catch for the fielder and West Indies have lost their first
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hemraj, OUT

dismissal.text: C Hemraj c Mohammad Mithun b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 9 (17b 2x4 0x6) SR: 52.94

items.text: fuller ball on the stumps, he pushes it back to the bowler's right
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Bravo, no run

items.preText: Syed Kabir: "Why do people want Bangladesh to continue going with 3 pacers? You would never ask England or Australia to go with 3 spinners in their own turf against sides who play spin well. WI clearly prefer pace, our pitches are more suited to spin and somehow selecting 2 pacers instead of 3 is bad. Nazmul Apu would have been the obvious choice over Rubel as Hope is susceptible to left arm spin. "
items.text: angled across on a length, steered to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run
